awd_titl_txt: NSFNET Connection for Saint Joseph's College (Maine)
awd_abstract_narration: 9417259  Murphy  St. Joseph College requests support from NSF for connection of  its campus network to the wide-area network provided by the  University of Maine.  They will provide operations management and  information services and it will give the college a 56 thousand  bits per second connection to the NSFNET, a high speed (1.5 - 45  million bits per second) National Backbone network.    Students and faculty research will benefit from the link.  By  linking to the mid-level and national networks St. Joseph's  faculty and academics will maintain a position of leadership in  research and educational innovation by profiting from remote  access to super computer centers, data bases and information  services, high speed communications, file transfer and remote  login, and access to library resources. This is also a unique  opportunity for the school to explore innovative educational  resources.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems
